description: Emission intensity for electric train travel (per passenger). This emission factor accounts for energy (electricity - at plant), including fuel combustion and upstream. The data for European countries were taken from a study of the International Union of Rail-ways (UIC) on external effects, commonly referred to as the INFRAS-IWW study, which was updated in October 2004 with reference year 2000. This study makes it possible to establish emission factors for rail passenger transport in different European countries for traction energy alone. All the available data integrate the upstream and combustion of the traction energy used. It does not include the manufacture of rolling stock or emissions related to the infrastructure (railway tracks, stations, etc.).
